newsitem.title: FINLAND: ICE HOCKEY-PRONGER JOINS CANADIAN TEAM.
newsitem.headline: ICE HOCKEY-PRONGER JOINS CANADIAN TEAM.

text.p: Canada completed their ice hockey world championship roster on Monday when they added St. Louis Blues defenceman Chris Pronger to their lineup.

Todd Simpson of the Calgary Flames, who travelled to Finland with the Canadian team but did not play in the first two games, will be dropped from the lineup to make room for the six-foot, five-inch (1.98 metres), 220 pound (100 kg) defenceman.

Pronger, who had 11 goals and 35 points for the Blues this season, will add some size to the Canadian blueline that was out-muscled, particularly in front of the net, in a 7-2 loss to Sweden on Sunday.
Both Pronger and Montreal Canadiens right winger Mark Recchi, who was added to the team on Sunday, are expected to be on the ice for Canada's next game against Latvia on Wednesday.
